meanings.definition: Relating to the texture of something.
meanings.sent1: The textural quality of the fabric was rough and bumpy.
meanings.sent2: The artist used different materials to create a textural masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chef's experiment with adding extra flour resulted in a surprisingly textural cake.
meanings.sent4: The landscape painter captured the textural essence of the mountains with his brushstrokes.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands could feel every textural detail of the clay as he molded it into shape.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to text.
meanings.sent1: The textural analysis of the document revealed hidden meanings.
meanings.sent2: The book's cover had a textural design that caught the eye of readers.
meanings.sent3: The student's essay was so textural that it seemed like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The poet's words painted a textural picture of emotions and thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The website's layout had a textural feel that made navigation easy for users.
